tools: One of {@item calligrapher's supplies|XPHB}, {@item dice set|XPHB}, {@item painter's supplies|XPHB}, {@item playing cards|XPHB}, or one {@item musical instrument|XPHB}

classFeature.name: Pact Magic
entries: Through channelling the energy of the spiritual world, you are able to manipulate the area around you through limited magical powers. See chapter 7 of the PHB for rules on spellcasting. The information below details the spellcasting rules specific for the Spiritualist.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two {@filter Spiritualist Cantrips|spells|level=0|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)} of your choice. {@spell Haunting Whispers|WoSpHa} and {@spell Thaumaturgy|XPHB} are recommended. Whenever you gain a Spiritualist level, you can replace one of your cantrips from this feature with another {@filter Spiritualist Cantrips|spells|level=0|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)} of your choice.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Spiritualist Features table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your Spiritualist spells of levels 1–5. The table also shows the level of those slots, all of which are the same level. You regain all expended Pact Magic spell slots when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

For example, when you're a level 5 Spiritualist, you have two level 3 spell slots. To cast the level 1 spell {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB}, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a level 3 spell.

entries.name: Prepared Spells of Level 1+
entries: You prepare the list of level 1+ spells that are available for you to cast with this feature. To start, choose two {@filter level 1 Spiritualist spells|spells|level=1|class=Spiritualist (WoSpHa)}. {@spell Inflict Wounds|XPHB} and {@spell Hex|XPHB} are recommended.

The number of spells on your list increases as you gain Spiritualist levels, as shown in the Prepared Spells column of the Spiritualist Features table. Whenever that number increases, choose additional Spiritualist spells until the number of spells on your list matches the number in the table. The chosen spells must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. When you reach level 6, for example, you learn a new Spiritualist spell, which can be of levels 1–3.

If another Spiritualist feature gives you spells that you always have prepared, those spells don't count against the number of spells you can prepare with this feature, but those spells otherwise count as Spiritualist spells for you.

entries.name: Changing Your Prepared Spells
entries: Whenever you gain a Spiritualist level, you can replace one spell on your list with another Spiritualist spell of an eligible level.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: {@i Choose One:} Charisma or Wisdom is the spellcasting ability used for your Spiritualist Spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use an {@item Arcane Focus|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Spiritualist Spells.

classFeature.name: Séance
entries: You can let a spirit possess you during a Séance. While possessed in this manner your willpower and magical prowess is increased. You can start a Séance using a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, provided you are holding your Spiritualist {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB}.

You can start a Séance the number of times shown for your Spiritualist level in the Séances column of the Spiritualist Features Table. You regain one expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
While active, the Séance follows the rules below.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You have resistance to Necrotic and Poison damage.

entries.name: Séance Damage
entries: When you deal damage with a cantrip or spell of 1st level or higher, you deal extra damage. This extra damage is equal to the Séance Bonus shown for your Spiritualist level in the Spiritualist Features Table.

entries.name: Séance Willpower
entries: While holding a Séance you can add your Séance Bonus to checks made with Intelligence (history), Wisdom (insight and perception), and Charisma (deception, performance, and persuasion) {@variantrule Ability Check|XPHB|Ability Checks}.

entries.name: Strengthened Willpower
entries: You have advantage on {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws} against being {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, or Possessed.

entries.name: A Voice Not Your Own
entries: While in a Séance you typically channel one returning spirit, whose voice and mannerisms you adopt.

entries.name: Duration
entries: The Séance lasts until the end of your next turn and ends early if you stop holding your Spiritualist {@item Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} or have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. If your Séance is still active on your next turn, you can extend the Séance for another round by doing the following:

items: Make an {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB} against an enemy, using your Cantrips or Spells.
Force an enemy to make a {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}, using your Cantrips or Spells.
Take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to extend your Séance

entries: Each time your Séance is extended, it lasts until the end of your next turn. You can maintain a Séance for up to 10 minutes.

classFeature.name: Medium Intuition
entries: Your connection to the spiritual world has allowed you to tap into your intuitions as a medium. You gain two Medium Intuitions of your choice, such as {@optfeature Ghostly Weapons|WoSpHa} and {@optfeature Spiritual Training|WoSpHa}. Medium Intuitions are described in the “{@filter Medium Intution Options|optionalfeatures|feature type=mein}” section later in this class’s description.

entries.name: Prerequisites
entries: If an intuition has a prerequisite, you must meet it to learn that intuition. For example, if an intuition requires you to be a level 5+ Spiritualist, you can select the intuition once you reach Spiritualist level 5.

entries.name: Replacing and Gaining Intuitions
entries: Whenever you gain a Spiritualist level, you can replace one of your intuitions with another one for which you qualify. You can't replace an intuition if it's a prerequisite for another intuition that you have.
When you reach Spiritualist level 5, 10, and 15, you gain two more Medium Intuitions.
You can’t pick the same Intuition more than once, unless the description says otherwise.

classFeature.name: Spiritual Secrets
entries: You can perform a cleansing ritual for 1 minute. At the end of it, you expend 1 use of Séances to regain 1 expended Pact Magic spell slot.
You can use this feature a number of times, equal to your Spiritualist spellcasting ability modifier, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Spiritualist Subclass
entries: You gain a Spiritualist subclass of your choice. The {@class Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Biokinetic Haunting|Biokinetic|WoSpHa}, {@class Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Cryokinetic Haunting|Cryokinetic|WoSpHa}, {@class Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Electrokinetic Haunting|Electrokinetic|WoSpHa}, {@class Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Pyrokinetic Haunting|Pyrokinetic|WoSpHa}, and {@class Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Telekinetic Haunting|Telekinetic|WoSpHa} subclasses are detailed after the class’s description. A subclass is a specialisation that grants you features at certain Spiritualist levels. For the rest of your career you gain each of the subclass’s features that are of your Spiritualist level or lower.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify (as detailed in {@book chapter 5|XPHB|5} of the PHB). You gain this feature again at Spiritualist levels 8, 12, and 16.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a Spiritualist subclass feature from your Spiritualist subclass.

classFeature.name: Other-Worldly Empowerment
entries: Whenever a creature dies, the spiritual world briefly gets strengthened. Whenever you or an ally reduce an enemy to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to empower your next spell. When casting that spell, you either get {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the {@variantrule Attack Roll|XPHB|Attack Rolls} or the targets get {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB}.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Spiritualist spellcasting modifier, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
You cannot use this feature when you or an ally reduces an Undead or Construct to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify (as detailed in {@book chapter 5|XPHB|5} of the PHB).

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a Spiritualist subclass feature from your Spiritualist subclass.

classFeature.name: Spiritual Insight (6th level)
entries: Your spiritual connection grants you the ability to use more advanced spells, known as Spiritual Insight. Choose one level 6 Spiritualist spell as this insight.
You can cast the insight spell once without expending a spell slot, and you must finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} before you can cast it in this way again.

As shown in the Spiritualist Features Table, you gain another Spiritualist spell of your choice that can be cast this way when you reach level Spiritualist levels 13 (level 7 spell), 15 (level 8 spell), and 17 (level 9 spell). You regain all uses of your Spiritual Insights when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
Whenever you gain a Spiritualist level you can replace one of your insight spells with another Spiritualist spell of the same level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify (as detailed in {@book chapter 5|XPHB|5} of the PHB).

classFeature.name: Spiritual Insight (7th level)
entries: You gain a level 7 Spiritualist spell of your choice.

classFeature.name: Subclass Feature
entries: You gain a Spiritualist subclass feature from your Spiritualist subclass.

classFeature.name: Spiritual Insight (8th level)
entries: You gain a level 8 Spiritualist spell of your choice.

classFeature.name: Thinning the Line
entries: You have spent so much time connecting with the spiritual world, that you have become less aware of the line between life and death. You gain {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}.
Additionally, you gain 30-foot Ethereal Sight, which allows you to see into the Ethereal Plane.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: You gain the {@feat Ability Score Improvement|XPHB} feat or another {@5etools feat|feats.html} of your choice for which you qualify (as detailed in {@book chapter 5|XPHB|5} of the PHB).

classFeature.name: Spiritual Insight (9th level)
entries: You gain a level 9 Spiritualist spell of your choice.

classFeature.name: Out-of-Body Experience
entries: You have connected with the spiritual world so much that you can remove your own spirit from your body. Whenever you hold a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa}, your own spirit increases your spell’s range by 60 feet.
Additionally, whenever you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to start a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa} or maintain it, you may cast one additional cantrip.

classFeature.name: Epic Boon
entries: You gain an  gain an {@filter Epic Boon feat|feats|category=EB} (see {@book chapter 5|XPHB|5} of the PHB) or another feat of your choice for which you qualify. The {@feat Boon of Dimensional Travel|XPHB} is recommended.

classFeature.name: Impenetrable Will
entries: Your Wisdom and Charisma scores increase by 4, to a maximum of 25.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Domain
entries: {@i Believe in Your Ancestors not a God}

The Ancestral Domain is one of the few domains that doesn’t follow a god. This domain draws the power from the Cleric’s ancestors. They pray to their ancestors for power to protect those in need and to strike down those in your way. These clerics tend to have varying ideals, as they fully depend on the core values that have been passed down in their family.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Domain Spells
entries: When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Ancestral Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Ancestral Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Dissonant Whispers|XPHB}, {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}, {@spell See Invisibility|XPHB}, {@spell Unseen Servant|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Ghost Envoy
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Cleric|XPHB|2|XPHB} to partially bring a spirit into the Material Plane in an unoccupied space you can see within 30 feet. The spirit remains in this plane for 1 minute, but ends early if you dismiss it (no action required), or become {@condition Incapacitated}. The spirit cannot be harmed, as it still mostly resides in the Ethereal Plane. While the spirit persists you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Cast Spells
entries: You can cast spells as though you were in the spirit’s space.

items.name: Chilling Aura
entries: When an enemy creature starts its turn within 5 feet of the spirit, their speed is reduced by half.

items.name: Move
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can move the spirit up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see that is within 120 feet of yourself. The spirit moves there in a straight line, going through objects and creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Haunting Rush
entries: Whenever you take your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to move the {@subclassFeature Ghost Envoy|Cleric|XPHB|Ancestral|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa} spirit, all enemy creatures it moves through must succeed a Wisdom saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition Frightened|XPHB} until the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Love
entries: The Ghost Envoy spirit has gotten stronger in the following ways.

items.name: Ancestral Healing
entries: When the spirit moves through a space of an ally it heals an amount of hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

items.name: Ancestral Protection
entries: When you or an allied creature is within 5 feet of the spirit, all attack rolls against them are made with disadvantage.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Spirits
entries: {@i Harness the Secrets of the Afterlife}

Druids of the Circle of Spirits commune with the lingering echoes of those who have passed. They serve as spirit medium, caretakers of restless souls, and guides for the living and the dead alike. Whether acting as a shepherd of wayward spirits or channelling their wisdom in battle, these druids weave their connection to spirits into their magic.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of Spirits Spells
entries: When you reach a Druid level specified in the Circle of Spirits Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit Speaker
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can expend a use of your {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|XPHB|2|XPHB} feature to channel a spirit, instead of shape-shifting. You can channel the spirit for 10 minutes, until you become Incapacitated, or choose to dismiss it early (no action required). When channelling you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Spirit Voice
entries: You can add your Wisdom modifier to checks made with Charisma.

items.name: Cold Touch
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you can attempt to touch a creature. Make a melee spell attack roll against that creature, on a hit they take cold damage equal to {@damage 1d8} + your Wisdom modifier.
This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} at Druid level 10 ({@dice 2d8}), and again at level 14 ({@dice 3d8}).

subclassFeature.name: Soothing Spirit
entries: Your spiritual connection has empowered your healing spells. Whenever you cast a healing spell of 1st level or higher you may add half your druid level (round down) to the hit points restored.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Levitation
entries: While your {@subclassFeature Spirit Speaker|Druid|XPHB|Spirits|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa} feature is active you gain the following benefits:

items.name: Flight
entries: You gain a fly speed equal to your speed.

items.name: Resistance
entries: You have resistance to Cold, Necrotic, and Psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Share the Spirit
entries: Instead of channelling the spirit, of the {@subclassFeature Spirit Speaker|Druid|XPHB|Spirits|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa} feature, into your own body, you can channel it into a willing creature within 60 feet of yourself. That creature gains the benefits of the {@subclassFeature Spirit Speaker|Druid|XPHB|Spirits|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa} feature and uses your Wisdom modifier for the features.
Additionally, you can channel a spirit into both the other creature and yourself if you expend two uses of your {@classFeature Wild Shape|Druid|XPHB|2|XPHB} instead of one when channelling it.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Warrior
entries: {@i Support Martial Prowess with Spiritual Guidance}

A Phantom Warrior walks the line between life and death to vanquish the spirits that remove to move on. These fighters do not merely train in physical combat, they also  sharpen their connection to the spirits they fight, in order to more easily defeat them. Whether trained by a lost order, cursed by fate, or choosing this path willingly, Phantom Warriors are feared as spectres of death.

subclassFeature.name: Ghostly Reflexes
entries: Your training in fighting those reluctant to move on, have honed your reflexes. You gain advantage on Initiative rolls and Dexterity (acrobatics) checks.
Additionally, after scoring a critical hit on your turn, you can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to {@action Disengage|XPHB} or {@action Dash|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Haunting Strike
entries: Your attacks carry the weight of the grave. Once on your turn after you hit a creature with a weapon attack, you can choose to apply one of the following effects:
The dice type changes to {@dice 1d8}s at level 10, and to {@dice 1d10}s at level 15.

subclassFeature.name: Haunting Strike (Haunting Whispers)
entries: You deal an additional amount of psychic damage, equal to {@damage 2d6}. If your target is Frightened or Charmed the damage increases by {@dice 1d6}.

subclassFeature.name: Haunting Strike (Phasing Weapon)
entries: Your weapon or ammunition phases through the creature. Roll an attack roll against a second creature within 5 feet of the original target, to also deal the weapon’s damage to it. Hit or miss both creatures take {@damage 1d6} Force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Haunting Strike (Psychic Scream)
entries: Force the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw, against a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier or become {@condition Frightened} until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Wraith's Defence
entries: After a creature hits you with an attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to momentarily dissolve into mist. You gain resistance to all damage dealt from that attack and you may move up to half your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Spectral Weapon
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you can summon forth a spectral version of the melee weapon you are holding, within an unoccupied space within 30 feet. The weapon lasts for 1 minute, you get the Incapacitated condition, or dismiss it (no action required).

When you take the attack action, for each attack you can choose to use the Spectral Weapon, instead of attacking yourself. The Spectral weapon uses the same damage die as the weapon you are holding, but deals Force, Necrotic, or Psychic damage (your choice upon summoning it). You use your Intelligence modifier for its attack and damage rolls.
Hitting with the spectral weapon will still allow you to use the {@subclassFeature Haunting Strike|Fighter|XPHB|Phantom|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa} feature.
On following turns you can move the weapon up to 30 feet using your bonus action.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Phantom Strikes
entries: You gain the following options that you can use for your {@subclassFeature Haunting Strike|Fighter|XPHB|Phantom|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa} feature:

subclassFeature.name: Haunting Strike (Lifedrain)
entries: You deal an additional {@damage 2d10} necrotic damage and heal for half the necrotic damage dealt (round up)

subclassFeature.name: Haunting Strike (Misty Strike)
entries: You deal an additional {@damage 2d10} force damage and teleport to a location you can see within 15 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Death Defiance
entries: Your fight against the spirits has made it harder for death to claim you. You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage while you are {@variantrule Bloodied|XPHB}.

items.name: Death Avoidance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can choose to drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead and teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.
You can use this feature once, regaining the use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Ancestors
entries: {@i Let Your Strikes be Guided by Your Ancestors}
Monks who choose this tradition have always believed that they should honour their ancestors. And because of that their ancestors want to protect them and let them make a difference.
Unlike many other monks, the ones who choose this tradition don’t come from monasteries, but from families they love dearly.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Protection
entries: When you choose this tradition at 3rd level, you can feel the presence of your ancestors trying to protect you from harm. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you can spend 1 Focus Point to gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your Martial Arts Die + your Wisdom modifier.

When you use {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk|XPHB|2} or {@subclassFeature Ancestral Blow|Monk|XPHB|Ancestors|WoSpHa|3}, you can replace one of those attacks for this feature, without expending a Focus Point.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can see between the veil of the living and the dead. You gain 30 feet of ethereal sight, which allows you to see both the material and the ethereal plane.

subclassFeature.name: Ancestral Blow
entries: Also at 3rd  level, you can use a bonus action to spend 1 Focus Point to make your ancestors attack two creatures you can see within 30ft of you. Make a melee attack roll, using Wisdom, for each creature they attack. The force damage is equal to your Martial Arts die + your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Helpers
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can contact your ancestors to help you in your endeavours. You can now use the {@action Help|XPHB} action, for attacks, as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, as your ancestors will distract the enemy for you.
In addition to that you can use an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} to spend 2 Focus Points to gain the following benefits for 1 hour:

items: The spirits will help you determine someone’s true intentions, giving you advantage on Wisdom (insight) checks.
The spirits will help you locate objects and creatures, giving you advantage on Wisdom (perception) and Intelligence (investigation) checks.
The spirits will relay your messages to anyone within a mile radius, whispering it in their ear. They will also relay the response to you.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Strike
entries: Starting at 11th level, you can use the ethereal plane to move from one enemy to the other. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action, you can teleport up to 10ft before each attack. If you attack at least two creatures in this way, you don’t have to spend a Focus Point to use {@classFeature Flurry of Blows|Monk|XPHB|2} or {@subclassFeature Ancestral Blow|Monk|XPHB|Ancestors|WoSpHa|3}.

subclassFeature.name: Guardian Angel
entries: Starting at 17th level, your connection with your ancestors is so close that they can send forth a physical manifestation of their will to protect you.  As an action you can cast an 8th level {@spell Summon Celestial|XPHB}, without requiring the material components and concentration. Wisdom is used for the spell attack modifier.
You can use this feature once, regaining the use when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Spiritualism
entries: {@i Seek to Become a Better You}

Paladins who swear the Oath of Spiritualism dedicate themselves to the pursuit of enlightenment, guiding souls, and uncovering the hidden truths of existence. They seek to transcend the limits of the physical world through harmonising with the spiritual one. Whether through meditation, communion with spirits, or unravelling the mysteries of the afterlife, these paladins walk a path that bridges the material and the divine.
These paladins share the following tenets:

items: Knowledge is the key to transcendence. Never stop searching for deeper truths.
Just as the body must be trained, so must the spirit. Maintain peace within yourself and guide others towards harmony.
The afterlife is sacred, and spirits are to be honoured, not exploited. Protect lost souls and ensure they find their way.
Superstition and fear cloud the mind. Shed light on the mysteries of the unseen and help others understand what lies beyond.

subclassFeature.name: Oath of Spiritualism Spells
entries: When you reach a Paladin level specified in the Oath of Spiritualism Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Guided Soul
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you can expend one use of your {@classFeature Channel Divinity|Paladin|XPHB|3|XPHB} to grant spiritual clarity. For 1 minute, the creature you touch gains advantage on Wisdom and Intelligence saving throws, as well as immunity to getting the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Serenity
entries: Your presence brings spiritual stability to those around you. You and friendly creatures have resistance to necrotic, psychic, and radiant damage while in your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Transcendent Mind
entries: Your understanding of the spiritual realm gives you proficiency in Intelligence saving throws, if you don’t have it already.
Additionally, you can cast {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB} without expending a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Enlightenment
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can imbue your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6|XPHB} with Enlightenment, granting the benefits below for 1 minute or until you dismiss it (no action required). Once you use this feature, you can’t use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also restore your use of it by expending a level 5 spell slot (no action required).

items.name: Truesight
entries: You and allies in your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6|XPHB} gain 30 feet of Truesight.

items.name: Undying
entries: Your allies in your {@classFeature Aura of Protection|Paladin|XPHB|6|XPHB} cannot be reduced below 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point}, unless the effect would kill the creature outright.

items.name: Light of the Enlightened
entries: Your aura is filled with {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} that is considered sunlight.

subclassFeature.name: Ghost Walker
entries: {@i Walk Among the Dead}
Ghost Walkers have been raised to love the barrier between life and death. Their love has manifested in them becoming more ghostly than other rangers.

subclassFeature.name: Ghost Walker Spells
entries: When you reach a Ranger level specified in the Ghost Walker Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Ghostly Resilience
entries: Your ghostly connection grants you advantage on saving throws to avoid or end being {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, and Possessed.

subclassFeature.name: Ghost Run
entries: You can take the {@action Dash|XPHB} and {@action Disengage|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

Additionally, after taking the {@action Dash|XPHB} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action, you can move through other creatures and objects as if it were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. If you end your turn in an occupied space, you take {@damage 1d10} force damage, which cannot be reduced, and are moved to the closest unoccupied space.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Steps
entries: Stepping temporarily into the ethereal realm, you can cast {@spell Misty Step|XPHB} without expending a spell slot.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Clingy Ghost
entries: You gain a climb speed equal to your walking speed. This climbing speed allows you to walk along walls and ceilings without issue.
Additionally, you learn and can cast {@spell Levitate|XPHB} without expending a spell slot. When casting it in this way you can only target yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Ghostly Presence
entries: You emit a ghostly presence. When you take the {@action Dash|XPHB} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action, all enemy creatures you move within 5 feet of must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 2d10} cold, necrotic, or radiant (your choice) damage or half as much on a successful save. A creature cannot take this damage more than once per round.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Sorcery
entries: {@i Channel the Power of the Dead}

Born from the boundary between the Material and Ethereal Planes, your magic is infused with ghostly energy. Whether you have been touched by spirits or have drifted through the Ethereal Plane before birth, you exist between worlds ─ never quire fully in one or the other.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Sorcery Spells
entries: When you reach a Sorcerer level specified in the Ethereal Sorcery Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Ethereal Sorcery Spells
rows: {@spell Gentle Repose|XPHB}, {@spell Hex|XPHB}, {@spell Pass without Trace|XPHB}, {@spell Protection from Evil and Good|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Ghostly Step
entries: Your connection to the Ethereal Plane grants you unnatural mobility. You can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to gain the following benefits until the start of your next turn:

items.name: Ethereal Movement
entries: You become partially translucent, allowing you to move through the space of creatures and objects as if it were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. If you end your turn in an unoccupied space you take {@damage 1d10} force damage, which cannot be reduced, and are moved to the closest unoccupied space.

items.name: Weapon Avoidance
entries: Non-magical weapon attacks against you are rolled with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Phasewalk
entries: When using your {@subclassFeature Ghostly Step|Sorcerer|XPHB|Ethereal|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa}, you may also teleport to a space within 30 feet.
You can use this feature a number of times, equal to your Charisma modifier, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Touch of the Veil
entries: Your bond with the Ethereal Plane has allowed you to move more freely between the material and ethereal planes. You gain the following benefits:

items.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: You can see 30 feet into the Ethereal Plane.

items.name: Ethereal Step
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} you can cast the {@spell Blink|XPHB} spell with this feature, without expending a spell slot, but the spell ends at the start of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: One Foot in the Grave
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can choose to temporarily vanish into the Ethereal Plane, as if the {@spell Etherealness|XPHB} spell has been cast on you. At the start of your next turn, you regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to your sorcerer level and you can appear anywhere within 30 feet of space you disappeared from.
You can use this feature once, regaining the use when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or by expending 6 Sorcery Points (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Biokinetic Haunting
entries: {@i Control the Actions of Others}

Spiritualists who channel a spirit that lessens their grasp on that spiritualist, to possess others, belong to the Biokinetic Haunting group. These Spiritualists learn how to control their free roaming spirit, to control the actions of others.

subclassFeature.name: Biokinetic Spells
entries: Your connection to the spiritual world ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Spiritualist level specified in the Biokinetic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Biokinetic Spells
rows: {@spell Charm Person|xphb}, {@spell Command|xphb}, {@spell Hold Person|xphb}, {@spell Suggestion|xphb}

subclassFeature.name: Controlling Séance
entries: The spirit that you channel has started to get bored of your body. As a result, it will try possessing the others around you. While holding a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa} you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Minor Possession
entries: Once on your turn after casting a cantrip or spell of 1st level or higher, you can boost or hinder one of your targets. The target gets a bonus or penalty (your choice) to their {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB} results. The bonus/penalty is equal to your Séance bonus. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You gain resistance to Psychic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Charming Eyes
entries: Your look can very easily charm another creature. When you cast a spell from your {@subclassFeature Biokinetic Spells|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Biokinetic|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa}, you don’t require vocal, somatic, or material components. This spell also doesn’t consume a spell slot.
You can use this feature once, regaining the use when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or by expending 2 {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa|Séances} (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Double Possession
entries: When you cast {@spell Dominate Beast|XPHB} or {@spell Dominate Person|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to target one additional beast/humanoid.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your spellcasting modifier, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Master Possessor
entries: The spirit you channel has entered so many creatures, that it can now more easily do that.

entries.name: Instant Possession
entries: You learn the {@spell Dominate Monster|XPHB} spell, which you can only cast in a specific manner: When you start your {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa} you may cast Dominate Monster as part of the same {@variantrule Bonus action|XPHB}.
You can use this feature once, regaining the use when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Psychic Immunity
entries: You become immune to psychic damage, while holding a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa}.

subclassFeature.name: Cryokinetic Haunting
entries: {@i Be a Chill Up Someone’s Spine}

Spiritualists who channel spirits that lower the temperature around them more than others belong to the Cryokinetic Haunting group. These Spiritualists use the lowered temperature to harm and slow their enemies.

subclassFeature.name: Cryokinetic Spells
entries: Your connection to the spiritual world ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Spiritualist level specified in the Cryokinetic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Cryokinetic Spells
rows: {@spell Armour of Agathys|xphb}, {@spell Ice Blade|wospha}, {@spell Ice Knife|xphb}, {@spell Icey Floor|wospha}

subclassFeature.name: Frigid Séance
entries: The spirit that you channel has a much stronger effect on the temperature than the others. As a result, you will be making the area around you colder. While holding a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa} you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Frigid Aura
entries: All enemy creatures, who start their turn within 10 feet of you, will take cold damage. To determine this cold damage, roll a number of d4s, equal to your Séance Bonus.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You become resistant to Cold damage.

subclassFeature.name: Icy Eyes
entries: Your look is very cold, just seeing it may make you shiver. When you cast a spell from your {@subclassFeature Cryokinetic Spells|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Cryokinetic|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa}, you don’t require vocal, somatic, or material components. This spell also doesn’t consume a spell slot.
You can use this feature once, regaining the use when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or by expending 2 {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa|Séances} (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Even Colder
entries: When you deal cold damage, using your {@subclassFeature Frigid Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Cryokinetic|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa} feature, that creature can only move up to half their speed, until the start of their next turn.

Additionally, upon dealing {@subclassFeature Frigid Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Cryokinetic|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa} damage you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the damage dealt.

subclassFeature.name: Petrifying Chill
entries: The cold aura has made you permanently cold. So cold it could completely freeze someone.

entries.name: Freezing Touch
entries: When someone, within 5 feet, hits you with a melee attack, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to give them the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. That creature is {@condition Restrained|XPHB} for 1 minute. At the start of each of their turns they may make a Constitution saving throw, against your spellcasting save DC, to end the effect early.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Spiritualist spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of 1), regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Ice Immunity
entries: You gain immunity to cold damage, while you are holding a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa}.

subclassFeature.name: Electrokinetic Haunting
entries: {@i Wield the Power to Alter Power}

Spiritualists who channel spirits that have a strong electric charge belong to the Electrokinetic Haunting group. These Spiritualists use the static electricity of the spirits to boost or hinder the reflexes of creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Electrokinetic Spells
entries: Your connection to the spiritual world ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Spiritualist level specified in the Electrokinetic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Electrokinetic Spells
rows: {@spell Lightning Arc|wospha}, {@spell Lightning Blade|wospha}, {@spell Sparks|wospha}, {@spell Witch Bolt|xphb}

subclassFeature.name: Electrifying Séance
entries: The spirit you channel has a much stronger effect on the electrical charges around you. As a result, you can manipulate the static electricity around you. While holding a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa} you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Electrifying Reflexes
entries: You may take the {@action Dash|XPHB} or {@action Disengage|XPHB} action as the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to start or maintain the Séance.

entries.name: Charged Body
entries: You may add your Séance Bonus to Dexterity saving throws and saving throws you make against being {@condition Stunned|XPHB} or {@condition Paralysed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You become resistant to Lightning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Charged Eyes
entries: Your look is very electrifying, just seeing it may shock you. When you cast a spell from your {@subclassFeature Electrokinetic Spells|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Electrokinetic|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa}, you don’t require vocal, somatic, or material components. This spell also doesn’t consume a spell slot.
You can use this feature once, regaining the use when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or by expending 2 {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa|Séances} (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Static Electricity
entries: Your field of energy spreads around much more, granting you the following benefits while holding a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa}:

entries.name: Jolting Reflexes
entries: All allies who start their turn within 15 feet of you may take the {@action Dash|XPHB} and {@action Disengage|XPHB} action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on that turn.

entries.name: Static Reflexes
entries: All enemies who are within 15 feet of you get a penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws. The penalty is equal to the Séance bonus.

subclassFeature.name: Electricity Field
entries: The static electricity that surrounds you has made you more sensitive to your surroundings.

entries.name: Electric Sense
entries: You gain blindsight for 30 feet.

entries.name: Charge Body
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, while you can see a creature within 30 feet, you can make lightning arc across their body. That creature must succeed a Constitution saving throw, against your spellcasting saving throw, or all creatures have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against them, until the start of your next turn. Creatures wearing metal armour have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on this saving throw.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Spiritualist spellcasting modifier (minimum of 1), regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Electricity Immunity
entries: You gain immunity to lightning damage while holding a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa}.

subclassFeature.name: Pyrokinetic Haunting
entries: {@i Let Passion or Rage Visibly Burn}

Spiritualists who frequently experience fires burning brighter when holding a Séance, often consider themselves part of the Pyrokinetic Haunting group. These Spiritualists learn how to use the passion and rage of the spirit that they can channel, to make fires spontaneously appear.

subclassFeature.name: Pyrokinetic Spells
entries: Your connection to the spiritual world ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Spiritualist level specified in the Pyrokinetic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Pyrokinetic Spells
rows: {@spell Burning Hands|xphb}, {@spell Flame Blade|xphb}, {@spell Heat Metal|xphb}, {@spell Hellish Rebuke|xphb}

subclassFeature.name: Scalding Séance
entries: The spirit that you channel has such a passionate or angry personality that it empowers your damage output. While holding a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa} you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Fire Touch
entries: Once on your turn, you may add extra damage when you deal damage with a weapon attack or cantrip. To determine the extra damage, roll a number of d6s equal to your Séance Bonus and add them together. The extra damage is considered Fire damage.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You become resistant to Fire damage.

subclassFeature.name: Burning Eyes
entries: Your look can spontaneously start fires. When you cast a spell from your {@subclassFeature Pyrokinetic Spells|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Pyrokinetic|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa}, you don’t require vocal, somatic, or material components. This spell also doesn’t consume a spell slot.
You can use this feature once, regaining the use when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or by expending 2 {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa|Séances} (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Fire Spread
entries: When you deal Fire damage, using your {@subclassFeature Scalding Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Pyrokinetic|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa} feature, you may deal half that damage to all creatures within 5 feet of one target.

subclassFeature.name: Fire From Hell
entries: The fire burns so fiercely inside of you, it must be directly connected to the underworld.

entries.name: Stronger Fire
entries: You ignore Fire damage resistance and treat Fire damage immunity as a resistance.

entries.name: Heat Immunity
entries: You gain immunity to fire damage, while you are holding a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa}.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Haunting
entries: {@i Make Distant Objects Move and Float}

Spiritualists who frequently experience objects being moved around during their Séances belong to the Telekinetic Haunting group. These spiritualists use poltergeists to move objects and creatures around.

subclassFeature.name: Telekinetic Spells
entries: Your connection to the spiritual world ensures you always have certain spells ready; when you reach a Spiritualist level specified in the Telekinetic Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Telekinetic Spells
rows: {@spell Knock|xphb}, {@spell Levitate|xphb}, {@spell Tenser's Floating Disk|xphb}, {@spell Unseen Servant|xphb}

subclassFeature.name: Levitating Séance
entries: The spirit you channel has such a passion for moving objects that you can use it to your advantage. While holding a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa} you gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Poltergeist Activity
entries: When you start your Séance tiny sized objects will start levitating around you. The number of objects you get is equal to your Séance Bonus.

As part of the {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to start or maintain the Séance, you may make a ranged spell attack against one target for each object, within 30 feet. On a hit the target takes {@damage 1d4} + your spellcasting modifier bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: You become resistant to force damage.

subclassFeature.name: Forceful Eyes
entries: Your look can knock over objects. When you cast a spell from your {@subclassFeature Telekinetic Spells|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Telekinetic|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa}, you don’t require vocal, somatic, or material components. This spell also doesn’t consume a spell slot.
You can use this feature once, regaining the use when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} or by expending 2 {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa|Séances} (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Poltergeist Tricks
entries: When you use your {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} for a Poltergeist Activity, you can instead use more objects in the same attack, to get one of the effects listed below. You only deal damage as if you hit with one of the objects.

entries.name: Knock Down (2 Objects)
entries: A creature must succeed a Strength saving throw, against your spellcasting DC, or be knocked prone.

entries.name: Forceful (2 Objects)
entries: A creature must succeed a Strength saving throw, against your spellcasting DC, or be pushed 10 feet away or towards you.

entries.name: Levitate (3 Objects)
entries: A creature must succeed a Strength saving throw, against your spellcasting DC, or be moved 30 feet up into the air.

subclassFeature.name: Master Mover
entries: The spirit loves moving things around so much that you become very proficient at moving objects.

entries.name: Effortless Manipulation
entries: When you cast one of your {@subclassFeature Telekinetic Spells|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Biokinetic|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa}, you may target one additional creature/object.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Spiritualist spellcasting modifier, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Spectral Reach
entries: The range of your {@subclassFeature Telekinetic Spells|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|Biokinetic|WoSpHa|3|WoSpHa}, with a range of Touch or at least 5 feet, increases by 30 feet.

entries.name: Force Immunity
entries: You gain immunity to force damage, while holding a {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa}.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Patron
entries: {@i Make a Deal with Ghosts}

Your pact draws the power from the spirits of those who refuse to move on. When you choose this subclass, you might make a deal with a spirit that is as old as written time or a group of spirits. Whoever they are, your patron only wants to return to life themselves.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Spells
entries: When you reach a Warlock level specified in the Spiritual Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Spiritual Spells
rows: {@spell Augury|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Evil and Good|XPHB}, {@spell Dissonant Whispers|XPHB}, {@spell Levitate|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Lingering Spirit
entries: Your patron’s presence shields you from an untimely death. You gain the following benefits.

items.name: Escape Death
entries: You may add your Charisma modifier to the result of your {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}.

items.name: Protective Ward
entries: When you have been reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you gain temporary {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} equal to two times your Warlock level.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Influence
entries: When a creature, you can see within 30 feet, fails a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to add your Charisma modifier to the result, potentially turning a failure into a success.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Death Veil
entries: When an enemy creature, within 30 feet, is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} for one of the following options:

items.name: Death's Restoration
entries: You gain temporary hit points equal to your warlock level.

items.name: Fear of Death
entries: Force another creature, you can see within 30 feet, to make a Wisdom saving throw against your spell saving throw DC. On a failure the creature becomes {@condition Frightened|XPHB} for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the save at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

subclassFeature.name: Echo of the Forgotten
entries: You can channel your patron to gain the following benefits:

items.name: Blind Casting
entries: You no longer require seeing a target to cast a spell, if it is normally required.

items.name: Spirit Form
entries: When you use the {@subclassFeature Death Veil|Warlock|XPHB|Spiritual|WoSpHa|10|WoSpHa} ability, you become translucent, granting you resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Medium
entries: {@i Use Spirits to Learn Magic}

Your studies have brought you to better understanding the barrier between life and death. Unlike fellow peers, who use corpses as vessels, you seek the spirits for your goals of obtaining knowledge. Some may force spirits to do their bidding, while others offer to help the spirit move on in return for their help.

subclassFeature.name: Spells from Beyond the Grave
entries: The spirits impart their knowledge onto you. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, pick a number of spells from the Wizard’s spell list equal to your Intelligence modifier, which don’t have to be in your spell book. You are considered to be prepared in these spells, not counting towards your prepared maximum.

These spells are not added to your spell book and can be cast without it being on your person. If the spell has material components it does not consume and does not have a cost, you can cast it without needing the material components or arcane focus.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Guidance
entries: After failing a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you may call upon the spirits for help. You may reroll the {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, taking the new result (no action required).
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier, regaining all uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Spiritual Range
entries: The range of your Wizard spells is increased through the guiding force of the spirits. When you cast a cantrip or spell of 1st level or higher, your touch spells have a range of 10 feet. Spells with at least a range of 5 feet are increased by 30 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Advice from the Dead
entries: The spirits impart bits of wisdom into your mind, allowing you to grant specific benefits. As a bonus action choose one of the following options, which lasts until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can use this feature once a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

items.name: Comprehend Languages
entries: You can understand any written or spoken language.

items.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: You can cast {@variantrule See Invisibility|XPHB} without expending a spell slot.

items.name: Expertise
entries: You gain expertise in one skill or tool of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Protection from Beyond the Grave
entries: As a Magic {@variantrule Action|XPHB} you can channel the spirits to cross over and protect you and your allies for 1 minute, you get the Incapacitated condition, or until you dismiss it (no action required). When a creature makes an {@action Attack|XPHB|Attack Roll} against you or an ally you can see within 30 feet, you impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the attacker (no action required). The protected creature has resistance to all damage types until the start of their next turn.

The first time you activate the feature you suffer no adverse effects. For every other use before finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you take {@damage 2d8} psychic damage, which can’t be reduced in any way. The damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for every use after the 2nd, before finishing a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Afterlife Protection
entries: A new page appears in your Book of Ghosts when you conjure it. With your permission, a creature can take an {@variantrule Action|XPHB} to write its name on that page, which can contain a number of names equal to your Spiritualist spellcasting modifier (minimum of one name).

When any creature whose name is on the page is reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, the creature magically drops to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. Once this magic is triggered, no creature can benefit from it until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
As a Magic {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can erase a name on the page by touching it.

optionalfeature.name: Animal Bond
entries: Your spiritual connection makes you more capable of communicating with beasts. You can communicate with beasts, as if you are under the effect of the {@spell Speak with Animals|XPHB} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Double Sight
entries: You can use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to touch a willing creature and perceive through its senses until the end of your next turn. As long as the creature is on the same plane of existence as you, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on subsequent turns to maintain this connection, extending the duration until the end of your next turn. The connection ends if you don't maintain it in this way.

While perceiving through the other creature's senses, you benefit from any special senses possessed by that creature, and you can cast spells as if you were in your space or the other creature's space if the two of you are within 60 feet of each other.

optionalfeature.name: Energy Change
entries: You can more easily recognise changes in energy. You gain 30 feet of {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Ghostly Rituals
entries: Stitching together strands of spiritual energy you conjure forth a book in your hand at the end of a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. This Book of Ghosts (you determine its appearance) contains knowledge of the spirits you channel, which only you can access, granting the benefits below. The book disappears if you conjure another book or if you die.

entries.name: Rituals
entries: When you get this book choose two {@filter level 1 spells|spells|level=1|components & miscellaneous=ritual} spells that have the Ritual tag. The spells can be from any class’s spell list, and they must be spells you don’t already have prepared. While the book is on your person, you have the chosen spells prepared, and they function as Spiritualist spells for you, not counting to your prepared spell maximum. You can cast the spell only as a ritual.

entries.name: Learning More Rituals
entries: You can add more rituals to your Book of Ghosts. Whenever you find a {@filter Ritual Spell|spells|components & miscellaneous=ritual} in written form, you can spend 50 gp worth of magical ink and 2 hours for each level of the spell you are copying into your book. You can only cast spells in your book if you already have the required spell slot for it.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: The Book of Ghosts can be used as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for you.

optionalfeature.name: Ghostly Sense
entries: You unlock the sixth sense, which makes you more sensitive about your surroundings. You gain the following benefits:

entries.name: Spectral Knowledge
entries: After rolling initiative you may use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to get to know the resistances, immunities, and vulnerabilities of a creature you can see.

entries.name: Spectral Permanence
entries: Using a Magic {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can touch a solid surface (such as a flat wall, floor, or door) and discover if there is an open space within 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Ghostly Weapons
entries: With spiritual guidance you know how to use some weapons more efficiently. You gain the following benefits with two weapons of your choice, provided you are proficient in that weapon:

entries.name: Weapon Mastery
entries: You get the {@variantrule Weapon Mastery Properties|XPHB|Mastery Feature} for both the weapons you choose.

entries.name: Extend Séance
entries: Attacking with your Ghostly Weapons will now also extend your {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa} for another round.

entries.name: Séance Damage
entries: You may add your {@classFeature Séance|Spiritualist|WoSpHa|1|WoSpHa} Bonus to damage dealt with your Ghostly Weapons

entries.name: Attack Ability
entries: You can use your Spiritualist spellcasting ability instead of the Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use your Ghostly Weapons as a spellcasting modifier.
At the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you may exchange a Ghostly Weapon for another.

optionalfeature.name: Life Stealer
entries: Once on your turn when you hit a creature with your {@optfeature Ghostly Weapon|WoSpHa}, you can deal an extra {@damage 1d6} Cold, Necrotic, or Radiant damage (your choice), and get {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to the extra damage rolled.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Spirtual Training
entries: The spirit you channel has made you master the use of certain skills or tools. Choose two skills or tools in which you are {@variantrule proficiency|XPHB|proficient}. You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in them.

optionalfeature.name: Medium's Resilience
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Saving Throw|XPHB|Saving Throws} that you make to maintain your {@status Concentration|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Speak with Dead
entries: You can add {@spell Speak with Dead|XPHB} to your Book of Ghosts and cast it without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Armour
entries: You can add {@spell Mage Armor|XPHB|Mage Armour} to your Book of Ghosts and cast it on yourself without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Lessons
entries: You have received knowledge from one of the spirits you have channelled, allowing you to gain one {@filter Origin feat|feats|category=o} of your choice.

items.name: Repeatable
entries: You can gain this feature more than once. Each time you do so, choose a different {@filter Origin feat|feats|category=o}.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Range
entries: The attack range with your Ghostly Weapons increases by 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Residue
entries: When you hit with a {@variantrule Weapon Attack|XPHB}, you may choose between its normal damage type or Cold, Necrotic, or Radiant damage.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit Sight
entries: You can see normally in {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB} and {@variantrule Darkness|XPHB}—both magical and non-magical—within 120 feet of yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Spiritual Cantrips
entries: You may add 3 {@filter cantrips|spells|level=0} from any class’s spell list to your Book of Ghosts. These spells you can then cast whenever you have your Book of Ghosts on your person.

optionalfeature.name: Spiritual Messenger
entries: You gain the ability to {@variantrule telepathy|XPHB|telepathically} communicate to other creatures you can see within 60 feet. The other creature can only understand you if you share a common language. To them it sounds like some disembodied voice is whispering in their ear. The creature can reply to you by whispering their response.

optionalfeature.name: Spiritual Spellcasting
entries: When you take the attack {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, with your {@optfeature Ghostly Weapons|WoSpHa}, you can replace one attack with a cantrip.

optionalfeature.name: Spiritual Strikes
entries: You gain the Extra Attack feature, which you can only use for the weapons you have chosen using your {@optfeature Ghostly Weapons|WoSpHa} feature. With this feature, you can attack twice with the weapon instead of once when you take the attack {@variantrule Action|XPHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Spiritual Training
entries: A spirit you have channelled has taught you how to more efficiently use skills, tools, or weapons. Choose two skills, tools, or weapons to gain {@variantrule proficiency|XPHB} in.

items.name: Repeatable
entries: You can gain this feature more than once. Each time you do, choose different skills, tools, or weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Vision of the Spirits
entries: You can add {@spell Arcane Eye|XPHB} to your Book of Ghosts and cast it without expending a spell slot.

spell.name: Haunting Whispers
entries: You send forth a string of haunting words, such as prophesying its death, to a creature within range. That creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take {@damage 1d10} Psychic damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: The spell can target two creatures when you reach level 5, three at 11, and four at 17. You can target multiple creatures or the same one. If the same creature is targeted multiple times it only rolls the saving throw once, but takes damage as if targeted that many times.

spell.name: Ice Blade

m.text: a drop of water or a piece of ice

entries: You evoke a blade made of ice in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a rapier, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke it again as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.
As a Magic {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can make a melee spell attack with the ice blade. On a hit, the target takes Cold damage equal to {@damage 2d6} plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
On a hit the target’s speed is halved and it can’t use its {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} until the end of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The Cold damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|2-9|1d6} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Icey Floor

m.text: a drop of water or a handful of snow

entries: For the duration, magical ice covers the ground from a point you choose within range, which fills a 15-foot-radius circle. When a creature tries to move across the ice, it is considered {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}, and they must succeed a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure they fall prone and lose their remaining movement.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell's radius increases by 5 feet for each level above 2.

spell.name: Lightning Blade
entries: You evoke a lightning blade in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a shortsword, and it lasts for the duration If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke it again as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

As a Magic {@variantrule Action|XPHB}, you can make a melee spell attack with the lightning blade. On a hit, the target takes Lightning damage equal to {@damage 2d6} plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
On a hit the target gets disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws until the start of their next turn.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The Lightning damage increases by {@scaledamage 2d6|2-9|1d6} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Sparks
entries: Sparks of lightning erupt from a point of your choice within range. Each creature within a 10-foot-radius Sphere centred there, must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 3d8} Lightning damage or half as much on a successful one. Creatures made of metal or wearing metal armour have disadvantage on the save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The Lightning damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d8|2-9|1d8} for each level above 2nd.

spell.name: Hellfire Trap
entries: You touch a container to imbue it with fire, to trap those who shouldn’t have access to it. When you cast this spell, speak a command word. When a creature tries to obtain something from the container without speaking said command word, they must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 6d8} Fire damage or half as much on a success. After being activated the spell ends.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The Fire damage increases by {@scaledamage 3d8|3-9|1d8} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Manifest Ghost

m.text: a crystal ball worth at least 300gp

entries: You temporarily break the barrier between life and death to call forth a ghost in an unoccupied space in range. This ghost uses the {@creature Manifested Ghost|WoSpHa} statblock. When you cast this spell, choose a ghost type: Chilling, Energised, Hateful, Poltergeist, or Possession. The ghost resembles the type you have chosen, which determines which determines certain details in its statblock. The ghost disappears when it drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or the spell ends.

The ghost is an ally to you and your allies. In combat, the ghost shares your initiative count, but it takes its turns directly after yours. It obeys your verbal commands (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any, it takes the {@action Dodge|XPHB} action and uses its movement to avoid danger.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher use that spell level in the statblock

spell.name: Numbing Wind
entries: Freezing wind, forming a line of 120 feet long and 20 feet wide, blasts from a point you choose within range. Each creature that starts its turn in the line must succeed a Strength saving throw or be pushed 30 feet away from the point. Creatures that fail the saving throw also take {@damage 1d12} Cold damage and are considered {@condition Grappled|XPHB} until the start of their next turn. If the spell is cast during cold or rainy weather, creatures make the saving throw with disadvantage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The Cold damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d12|3-9|1d12} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Point Pull
entries: A point you choose within range starts to exude a strong magnetic force. Each creature within a 20-foot-radius sphere centred there must succeed a Strength saving throw or be pulled 10 feet towards the centre and take {@damage 4d8} Force damage or the creature doesn’t move and only takes half as much on a success. Loose objects are also moved 10 feet towards the centre.
Objects and creatures that collide both take an additional {@damage 2d8} Bludgeoning damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The force damage increases by {@scaledamage 1d8|3-9|4d8} for each level above 3rd.

spell.name: Blizzard Shape
entries: A willing creature you touch gets surrounded by a blizzard. While surrounded, the target gains a fly speed of 60 feet, and it can hover. The target has resistance to Cold damage. When the target moves within 5 feet of another creature for the first time that turn, it will take {@damage 1d6} Cold damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may target an additional creature for each slot level above 4.

spell.name: Jumping Jolt
entries: You release an arc of lighting at a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack roll against the target. On hit, the target takes {@damage 4d8} Lightning damage, and you can cause the spell to jump to another target within 20 feet of the first target making a new attack roll for each target. The spell cannot hit the same target twice or jump to a target out of the spell's range. The spell can jump a maximum of five times.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The Lightning damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d8|4-9|1d8} for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Lightning Rider
entries: You transform yourself into a bolt of lightning and teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Each creature within 5 feet of the line created between your starting point and final destination must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 4d6} Lightning damage or half as much on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The Lightning damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d6|2-9|1d6} for each level above 4th.

spell.name: Perfect Aim

m.text: (a piece of non-magical ammunition or a throwing weapon worth at least 5 cp

entries: You imbue one piece of ammunition or a throwing weapon with perfect aim. Instead of making a ranged weapon attack, you deal the weapon’s normal damage, using your spellcasting modifier, instead of the weapon’s, to 4 targets. These targets can be different creatures, the same one, or a mix of both, provided they are within 30 feet of you.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you may choose one additional target for each slot level above 4.

spell.name: Glacial Touch
entries: You touch one creature with an unfathomable cold hand. Make a melee spell attack, on a hit the target takes {@damage 8d10} cold damage and is {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} for the duration of the spell or only take half as much damage on a success. The creature can be freed from its frozen form early by dealing at least 30 Fire damage to it, in one turn.
If the damage from this spell kills a target, they are turned into a {@condition Petrified|XPHB} ice statue.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The Cold damage increases by {@scaledamage 8d10|5-9|1d10} for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Immolation
entries: Flames wreathe one creature you can see within range. The target must make a Dexterity saving throw. It takes {@damage 8d6} Fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, the target is also on fire for the spell's duration. The burning target sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the saving throw. It takes {@damage 4d6} Fire damage on a failed save, and the spell ends on a successful one. These magical flames can't be extinguished by non-magical means.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The end of turn Fire damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d6|5-9|1d6} for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Lightning Field
entries: A field of static lightning is created originating from a point you choose within range. A creature that starts its turn within the 20-foot-radius sphere centred there, must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} Lightning damage and move up to half their speed in a random direction or only take half as much damage on a success.
As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on your turn, you can move the Lightning field up to 20 feet in any direction, within the spell’s range.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The Lightning damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d8|5-9|1d8} for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Possession
entries: You can possess anything at a whim. When you cast this spell, you move 5 feet, directly into the area of a non-incorporeal creature or an object, provided it is not two sizes larger or smaller than you, to possess it. A creature must succeed a Charisma saving throw or become possessed.

A creature possessed by you becomes {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} but is aware of its surroundings. While possessing a creature, you cannot be targeted by an attack, spell, or other effect. You retain all your own statistics, apart from Strength, Dexterity, Constitution, and Speed, which uses the creature’s. You now control the creature you possess and take actions as them.
While possessing an object, you may move  it 30 feet a turn, provided the object isn’t secured to another surface.

The spell ends after a minute, if the creature or object drops to 0 HP, if you use a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to end it, or if the creature, upon taking damage, succeeds a Charisma saving throw.
Once the possession ends, you appear in the closest unoccupied space.

spell.name: Static Lightning
entries: Sparks of lightning shoot out of you in a 10-foot-radius emanation. All creatures within that radius must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} Lightning damage and become {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} for the duration of the spell. On a success they only take half as much damage. A {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The Lightning damage increases by {@scaledamage 4d8|5-9|1d8} for each level above 5th.

spell.name: Soul Shatter

m.text: A specially crafted black wand worth at least 1000gp.

entries: You point the wand at one target within range and utter some strange words, after which a purple streak of energy. The target must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 20d8} Necrotic damage, half as much on a success. If the spell reduces the target’s {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} to 0, then its soul shatters into two shards and the person dies instantly. Each soul shard enters the closest creature to it; each shard into a different creature. A possessed creature gains {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB} in one skill, tool, or saving throw, of their choice from the ones the soul had. If they are already proficient in all skills, tools, and saving throws the soul was as well, then they gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in one.

When two shards enter one creature they merge into a new soul, which will attempt to possess the creature they inhabit. The creature it attempts to possess must succeed a Charisma saving throw or be possessed by a Ghost (see Ghost stat block for details) and lose their gained {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB}. On a success the creature is not possessed and the second shard shatters.
