entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: Lightning

entries.name: Damage
entries: The ghost can choose to deal Lightning damage instead of Necrotic.

entries.name: Static Lightning
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the ghost takes {@damage 3} Lightning damage and all other lightning damage dealt is increased by {@damage 1d6}.

entries.name: Bonus Action: Release Energy (Recharge 6)
entries: The ghost can use another action this turn, but will have a -2 penalty to {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB|D20 Tests} on its next turn.

variant.name: Hateful Ghost Young Dragon
entries: Add the following features to the ghost for a Hateful Ghost Variant:

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: Fire

entries.name: Damage
entries: The ghost can choose to deal Fire damage instead of Necrotic.

entries.name: Burning Presence
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the ghost takes {@damage 3} Fire damage. All other fire effects in that area temporarily grow 5 feet in radius, and fires can’t be extinguished using non-magical means.

entries.name: Action: Burning Hatred (Recharge 5-6)
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 14}, all creatures within 15 feet of the ghost. {@actSaveFail} Take {@damage 3d6} Fire damage and be set on fire ({@hazard Burning|XPHB}). {@actSaveSuccess} Only half damage.

variant.name: Poltergeist Ghost Young Dragon
entries: Add the following features to the ghost for a Poltergeist Ghost Variant:

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: Force

entries.name: Damage
entries: The ghost can choose to deal Force damage instead of Necrotic.

entries.name: Manipulation
entries: The ghost can move and otherwise interact with creatures and objects. (Replaces {@i Spectral Form})

entries.name: Forceful Strikes
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 14}, Whenever the ghost makes an attack roll that deals Force damage. {@actSaveFail} The target is pushed 5 feet or knocked {@variantrule Prone|XPHB}.

entries.name: Action: Throw Objects
entries: The ghost throws 3 objects, to targets in range. {@atkr r} {@hit 8}, range 20/60, one target. Hit: 8 ({@damage 1d6+5}) Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage.

variant.name: Possession Ghost Young Dragon
entries: Add the following features to the ghost for a Possession Ghost Variant:

entries.name: Damage Resistance
entries: Psychic

entries.name: Damage
entries: The ghost can choose to deal Psychic damage instead of Necrotic.

entries.name: Bonus Action: Minor Possession
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 14}, one creature it can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} The creature is given a command, which it follows, as if under the effect of the {@spell Command|XPHB} spell.

entries.name: Action: Possession (Recharge 6)
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 14}, one beast, dragon, giant, humanoid, or monstrosity the ghost can see within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target is possessed by the ghost; the ghost disappears, and the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and loses control of its body. The ghost now controls the body, but the target retains awareness. The ghost can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that specifically target Undead. The ghost's game statistics are the same, except it uses the possessed target's Speed, as well as the target's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 Hit Points or the ghost leaves as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. When the possession ends, the ghost appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and the target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours. {@actSaveSuccess} The target is immune to this ghost's Possession for 24 hours.

trait.name: Chilly Presence
entries: A creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the ghost takes {@damage 3} Cold damage and has its speed reduced by 10 feet.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ghosts can move through other creatures and objects as if it is {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object or creature.

trait.name: Spectral Form
entries: The ghost cannot move or pick up objects or creatures.

entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 15}, each creature in a 30-foot Cone. {@actSaveFail} 40 ({@damage 9d8}) Necrotic damage. The damage type can be replaced with Cold. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

entries.name: Spiritualist
entries: Having been very close to dying, a Spiritualist has become more sensitive to the other world, where spirits reside. They use this sensitivity to channel spirits to help others talk to their loved ones or even use the ghost’s power in combat. When channelling such a spirit a spiritualist allows the spirit to fully enter their body, granting the spirit a semblance of control. This control is only partial as a Spiritualist exactly knows how to stay aware and direct the actions of the spirit.

Spiritualists tend to be followed around by a single spirit. This spirit can be seen as their guardian angel. However, usually it is just a departed humanoid or maybe it is even a demon who feels it can use the Spiritualist for their own ends. No matter what type the spirit is, without it the Spiritualist would have a harder time using their powers, as spirits tend to stick around inhabited places.

Spiritualists tend to be very eccentric people, as dealing with things others can’t see or feel tends to make you stand out. They often take up jobs as  mediums, artists, travelling performers, or travelling salesmen, as their eccentric nature usually doesn’t allow them to have boring jobs.

Spiritualists generally see adventures as a necessity. Their eccentric nature tends to get on the nerves of people, if they stay in one place too long. Others believe that they have this power to help those in need of seeing their loved ones, which they need to travel for.

entries.name: Ghosts
entries: {@i Bound Spirit}

Ghosts arise when living creatures die in a state of extreme emotion, having left unfinished business, or just by dying in a place that is cursed. These incorporeal spirits haunt the locations they died in, unable to leave its boundaries. Some spirits may not realise that they have died and will see any person moving into their house as an intruder.

Ghosts typically are unseen until they become agitated. When agitated they appear as semi-translucent versions of the creatures they have died as. Though even if a ghost remains unagitated the living can still feel their presence. The living report hearing unexplained footsteps and other sounds as well as a general feeling of being watched in an area with a ghost.

entries.name: Ghost Exorcism
entries: Since ghosts are already dead they need to be exorcised.  A ghost can be exorcised by defeating it after having had religious chanting, ending the curse on the area it is trapped in, or finishing its unfinished business. A friendly ghost might also move on without needing to fight it, if you remove the curse or finish their unfinished business.

entries.name: Ghost Types
entries: Ghosts come in six types, the Chilling, Energised, Hateful, Poltergeist, Possession ghosts, and mundane ghosts. Most ghosts fall under the mundane ghost type, but those that are more powerful often belong to one of the others.

items.name: Mundane
entries: Mundane Ghosts can typically only interact with the living world by manifesting in front of the loving and by draining their energy.

items.name: Chilling
entries: A Chilling Ghost is a ghost that affects its surroundings by lowering its temperature.

items.name: Energised
entries: An Energised Ghost brings static electricity with it. If they are present you may see sparks of lightning appear from metal.

items.name: Hateful
entries: A Hateful Ghost is a ghost that raises the temperature around it. These ghosts may even make flames burn brighter or even start new ones.

items.name: Poltergeist
entries: A Poltergeist Ghost is the only ghost type that can interact with objects and move them around.

items.name: Possession
entries: A Possession Ghost is the only ghost type that can enter the body of a living creature. While possessing this creature they can even control their actions.

entries.name: Creating a Ghost
entries: Change the following features of a creature to make a ghost version of any type of creature:

items.name: Creature Type
entries: Undead

items.name: Speed
entries: 5ft., fly (hover) equal to base or fly

items.name: Damage Resistance
entries: Bludgeoning, Cold, Piercing, Slashing, Thunder

items.name: Damage Immunity
entries: Necrotic, Poison

items.name: Condition Immunity
entries: {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, {@condition Petrified|XPHB}, {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, {@condition Prone|XPHB}, {@condition Restrained|XPHB}

items.name: Senses
entries: Darkvision 60 ft. (unless it already has one higher than that)

items.name: Damage
entries: The creature’s damage should be replaced with necrotic.

items.name: Additions
entries: Add the following features (see stat blocks below for reference): {@i Ethereal Sight}, {@i Incorporeal Movement}, {@i Spectral Form},  {@i Etherealness} (Either Wisdom or Charisma is used as spellcasting ability), and {@i Horrifying Visage} (DC equals 8 + PB + Charisma or Wisdom mod).

Most ghosts a creature will encounter will often be classified as a common ghost, which are ghosts of humanoids. These ghosts are ones that rarely interact with the living. They usually lack the power of an older ghost to do so or are ones that think it is not their place to meddle with the living.
Common Ghosts could also be ghostly versions of beasts, such as dogs and horses.

Fierce Ghosts are the ones that outright reject having any living creatures in their area. They see any form of intrusion as an incentive to become aggravated. Some evil spirits, who take pleasure in harming the living, also belong in this group.

Ancient Ghosts have been around as a spirit for at least 100 years. These ghosts have had plenty of time to hone their incorporeal skills. Some may be helpful guides, while others are more likely to be spiteful and end a living’s life.

Any creature of the aberration, dragon, fey, giant, and monstrosity type could become a ghost. These ghosts retain many of their abilities, but have their damage replaced with necrotic. These ghosts can also not usually interact with objects and creatures like the living can. The two monstrous ghosts listed here are the Dragon and the Beholder.

legendaryGroup.name: Ghosts
regionalEffects: The region containing the lair of the ghost is affected by its presence, creating the following effect. If the ghost is exorcised, then the effects end immediately.

items.name: Abandoned Appearance
entries: The area within 1 mile of the lair appears to be run down. The plants are overgrown, windows are shattered, and wallpaper is torn. Any object left unattended for 24 hours in the area, will become damaged and unusable.

items.name: Being Watched
entries: While in 1 mile of the lair, you constantly feel like you are being watched. You have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Dexterity (stealth and sleight of hand) checks, while in the area.

items.name: Ghostly Gloom
entries: The area within 1 mile of the lair is {@variantrule Lightly Obscured|XPHB} by unsettling fog. Whenever a creature other than the undead finishes a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} in that area, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or have its Speed reduced by 10 feet for 1 hour.

item.name: Spirit Board
entries: A Spirit Board is a board with letters, numbers, 'yes', 'no', 'hello', and 'goodbye' written on it. Together with a planchette it is used to communicate with ghosts. A {@class Spiritualist|WoSpHa} can use it as their {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus}
